titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَالَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
titles.en: Chapter 46 – The one who says, ‘Whatever Allah<sup>azwj</sup> so Desires, there is neither Might nor Strength except with Allah<sup>azwj</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَالَ أَسْتَغْفِرُ اللَّهَ الَّذِي لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ ذُو الْجَلَالِ وَ الْإِكْرَامِ وَ أَتُوبُ إِلَيْهِ
titles.en: Chapter 47 – The one who says, ‘I seek Forgiveness of Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, Who, there is no God except Him<sup>azwj</sup>, the Living, with Majesty and the Benevolence, and I repent to Him<sup>azwj</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَالَ لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ مُخْلِصاً
titles.en: Chapter 45 – The one who says, ‘There is no god except Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’, sincerely

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ قَالَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ
titles.en: Chapter 46 – The one who says, ‘Whatever Allah<sup>azwj</sup> so Desires, there is neither Might nor Strength except with Allah<sup>azwj</sup>

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/212)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا دَعَا الرَّجُلُ فَقَالَ بَعْدَ مَا دَعَا مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ قَالَ اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ اسْتَبْسَلَ عَبْدِي وَ اسْتَسْلَمَ لِأَمْرِي اقْضُوا حَاجَتَهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Hisham Bin Salim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When a man supplicates and he says after having supplicated, ‘Whatever Allah<sup>azwj</sup> so Desires. There is neither Mighty nor Strength except with Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic Says: “My<sup>azwj</sup> servant is striving and submitting to My<sup>azwj</sup> Command. Fulfil his need!”’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Hisham ibn Salim from abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) who has said the following: “When a man prays and thereafter says, ‘As Allah wills, there are no means and no power without the help of Allah,’ Allah, the Most Majestic, the Most Holy, says, “My servant has accepted dying and has submitted himself to My command. Provide him the help that he needs.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/214)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ جَمِيلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ مَنْ قَالَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ لَا حَوْلَ وَ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ سَبْعِينَ مَرَّةً صَرَفَ عَنْهُ سَبْعِينَ نَوْعاً مِنْ أَنْوَاعِ الْبَلَاءِ أَيْسَرُ ذَلِكَ الْخَنْقُ قُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ وَ مَا الْخَنْقُ قَالَ لَا يَعْتَلُّ بِالْجُنُونِ فَيُخْنَقَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from one of his companions, from Jameel,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I heard him<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘The one who says, ‘Whatever Allah<sup>azwj</sup> so Desires. There is neither Might nor Strength except with Allah<sup>azwj</sup>’, seventy times, there would be exchanged away from him seventy types from the types of afflictions, the least of that being the suffocation’. I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! And what is the suffocation?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘He will not fall sick with the insanity, so he would suffocate’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from certain individuals of his people from Jamil who has said the following: “I heard abu ‘Abd Allah (a.s.) saying, ‘Whoever says, “As Allah wills, there are no means and no power without the help of Allah,” seventy times, seventy kinds of misfortunes will be diverted away from him, the least of which is al-Khanq .’ I (the narrator) then asked, ‘May Allah keep my soul in service for your cause, what is al-Khanq ?’ The Imam said, ‘He will not suffer from mental illness (insanity).”’
